classes.cCustomNote: Choose one of the following: ENGL133, or ENGL134.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, B4, Upper-Division B, C1, Lower-Division C Elective, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, E, F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Upper-Division C must be satisfied by taking a non-English course. Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP), and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Any Free Elective course can go here. Recommended: Foreign Language 101.

Majors must demonstrate intermediate-level proficiency in a foreign language. Any language classes needed before the intermediate level will count as free electives. With approval, students can substitute for this requirement by demonstrating a comparable level of proficiency in a foreign language.

English majors are encouraged to use their upper-division ENGL electives to pursue their interests, including literature, creative writing, linguistics, and/or rhetoric and writing. Minimum 12 units in 400-level literature within the 24 units of 400-level courses.

Approved ENGL 300-level Non-Literature Electives: ENGL310, ENGL311, ENGL312, ENGL317, ENGL319, ENGL361, ENGL368, ENGL370, ENGL371, ENGL372, ENGL373, ENGL387, ENGL388, ENGL390, ENGL391, ENGL395. The course used to fulfill non-literature elective cannot also fulfill 300 level general elective in the major core.
